Feature: Are there definite or specific articles?
Do indefinite nominals commonly have indefinite articles?
Are there prenominal articles?
Are there postnominal articles?
What is the order of numeral and noun in the NP?
Example:
beš adam
[five man]
‘five men’

Feature: What is the order of adnominal demonstrative and noun?
Example:
bu oɣlan
[this boy]
‘this boy’

Feature: Can adnominal property words occur discontinuously?
Example:
*ev män-dä gözäl-dir
[house 1SG-LOC nice-PRED]
‘My house is nice.’
män-im ev-im gözäl-dir
[1SG-GEN house-1SG nice-PRED]
‘My house is nice.’

Feature: Are nominal conjunction and comitative expressed by different elements?
Example:
orxan vä їqor
[Orhan and Igor]
‘Orhan and Igor’
їqor, Orxan ilä
[Orhan Igor with]
‘Orhan with Igor’

Feature: Is there an inclusive/exclusive distinction?
Is there a gender distinction in independent 3rd person pronouns?
Is there a dual or unit augmented form (in addition to plural or augmented) for all person categories in the pronoun system?
Are there three or more distance contrasts in demonstratives?
Example:
bu ‘this’
o ‘that’

Feature: Do demonstratives show an elevation distinction?
Do demonstratives show a visible-nonvisible distinction?
Are there demonstrative classifiers?
Is there nonphonological allomorphy of noun number markers?
Are there several nouns (more than three) which are suppletive for number?
Is there productive overt morphological singular marking on nouns?
Is there productive morphological dual marking on nouns?
Is there productive morphological plural marking on nouns?
Is there an associative plural marker for nouns?
Detailed comment: the same as the plural marker, -lar and allomorphs

Feature: Is there a productive morphological pattern for deriving an action/state noun from a verb?
Is there a productive morphological pattern for deriving an agent noun from a verb?
Is there a productive morphological pattern for deriving an object noun from a verb?
Comment: there is an affix deriving nouns meaning the result of an action

Is there a noun class/gender system where shape is a factor in class assignment?

Are there possessive classifiers?
Is the adnominal possessive construction different for alienable and inalienable nouns?
What is the pragmatically unmarked order of adnominal possessor noun and possessed noun?

yumurta aɣdır 'The egg is white’
yumurta aɣ idi ‘The egg was white’

Feature: Do core adjectives (defined semantically as property concepts; value, shape, age, dimension) used attributively require the same morphological treatment as verbs?
Example: aɣ yumurta ‘white egg’

Are there morphological cases for pronominal core arguments (i.e. S/A/P)?

Are there postpositions?

Do verbs have suffixes/enclitics, other than those that ONLY mark A, S or O (do include portmanteau: A & S + TAM)?

Is there overt morphological marking on the verb dedicated to past tense?
Is there overt morphological marking on the verb dedicated to future tense?

Can the S argument be indexed by a prefix/proclitic on the verb in the simple main clause?

Is there an instrumental applicative marker on the verb (including indexing)?

Is there verb suppletion for tense or aspect?
Are there conjugation classes?

Is there a phonologically bound reciprocal marker on the verb?
Do verbs classify the shape, size or consistency of absolutive arguments by means of incorporated nouns, verbal affixes or suppletive verb stems?

Can aspect be marked by an inflecting word ("auxiliary verb")?

aux 'to sit’ - progressive
aux 'to remain/stay’ - progressive

Feature: Can tense be marked by an inflecting word ("auxiliary verb")?
Is verb compounding a regular process?
Are there verb-adjunct (aka light-verb) constructions?

Detailed comment:
var
also used to indicate location and predicative possession
Example:
män-im pišiy-ïm var
[1SG-POSS.1SG cat-POSS.1SG be]
‘I have a cat.’

Feature: Are different posture verbs used obligatorily depending on an inanimate locatum's shape or position (e.g. 'to lie' vs. 'to stand')?
Example:
kitab masa-nïn üstündä-dir
[book table-GEN be.on-PRED]
kitab masa-da-dïr
[book table-LOC-PRED]
‘The book is on the table.’
stäkan masa-da-dïr
[glass table-LOC-PRED]
stäkan masa-nïn üstündä
[glass table-GEN be.on]
stäkan masa-nïn üstündä-dir
[glass table-GEN be.on-PRED]
‘The glass is on the table.’

Feature: Is there a notably small number, i.e. about 100 or less, of verb roots in the language?

Is a pragmatically unmarked constituent order verb-medial for transitive clauses?

Do clausal objects usually occur in the same position as nominal objects?

Example:
o istäjir-di ki körpä bala-lar-ї išїġlї kün üzünä häsrät ġal-ma-sїn

Feature: Is the order of core argument (i.e. S/A/P) constituents fixed?
Can standard negation be marked clause-finally?
Can standard negation be marked clause-initially?
Is there a difference between imperative (prohibitive) and declarative negation constructions?
Example:

[2SG book read-NEG-2SG]

[book-ACC read-NEG]

Feature: Is verbal predication marked by the same negator as all of the following types of predication: locational, existential and nominal?

[3SG ill]

Example: participles are used to distinguish the relative order of events

Feature: Are causatives formed by affixes or clitics on verbs?
Is there a causative construction involving an element that is unmistakably grammaticalized from a verb for 'to say'?

Comment: repeated forms do not constitute phonological words

Comment: it is not clear whether these constitute phonological words

Feature: Is there a male/female distinction in 2nd person independent pronouns?
